newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Electrafina rises on Suez cash talk.
newsitem.headline: Electrafina rises on Suez cash talk.

text.p: Shares in Belgian holding company Electrafina gained 0.5 percent on Tuesday after another major shareholder of French company Cie de Suez said Suez should distribute some of its cash ahead of a merger with Lyonnaise des Eaux.

Jean-Louis Beffa, head of Saint-Gobain, which is a major shareholder in Suez, said he believed it would be reasonable for Suez to distribute some 10 percent of its 34 billion French francs in cash to its shareholders.
He said the call was supported by AXA and BNP, which are also Suez shareholders. Electrafina, which owns 8.3 percent of Suez, declined to comment.
By 1230 GMT, Electrafina's share was up 0.5 percent at 3,490 Belgian francs.
Suez and Lyonnaise des Eaux are due to discuss a possible merger on April 11.
Electrafina is an investment vehicle of Belgian financier Albert Frere's Groupe Bruxelles Lambert (GBL).
